text:
Often in an Ant project, there is a couple of targets, which are a prerequisite
for all other targets.

One of those targets could generate a message:

  "This is the Ant build file for ..."

That message should only be written once, therefore a target could have an
attribute called runeonce with the values (yes or no). Default should be no..
creator: js@nw3.dk
jan@materne.de
text:
With CVS version you can write that directly under <project>, so that would 
echoed once:


<project default="doNothing">
    <echo>This is the Ant build file for ...</echo>

    <target name="doAll">
        <echo>working...</echo>
    </target>
  
    <target name="doNothing"/>
</project>


The first <echo> is processed whether you define a target or not.
